  16. (* Register allocation by coloring of the interference graph *)

  18. module OrderedRegSet =
  19.   Set.Make(struct
  20.     type t = Reg.t
  21.     let compare r1 r2 =
  22.       let open Reg in
  23.       let c1 = r1.spill_cost and d1 = r1.degree in
  24.       let c2 = r2.spill_cost and d2 = r2.degree in
  25.       let n = c2 * d1 - c1 * d2 in
  26.       if n <> 0 then n else
  27.         let n = c2 - c1 in
  28.         if n <> 0 then n else
  29.           let n = d1 - d2 in
  30.           if n <> 0 then n else r1.stamp - r2.stamp
  31.   end)

  33. open Reg

  35. ‌let allocate_registers() =

  37.   (* Constrained regs with degree >= number of available registers,
  38.      sorted by spill cost (highest first).
  39.      The spill cost measure is [r.spill_cost / r.degree].
  40.      [r.spill_cost] estimates the number of accesses to [r]. *)
  41.   let constrained = ref OrderedRegSet.empty in

  43.   (* Unconstrained regs with degree < number of available registers *)
  44.   let unconstrained = ref [] in

  46.   (* Reset the stack slot counts *)
  47.   let num_stack_slots = Array.make Proc.num_register_classes 0 in

  49.   (* Preallocate the spilled registers in the stack.
  50.      Split the remaining registers into constrained and unconstrained. *)
  51.   let remove_reg reg =
  52.     let cl = Proc.register_class reg in
  53.     if reg.spill then begin
  54.       (* Preallocate the registers in the stack *)
  55.       let nslots = num_stack_slots.(cl) in
  56.       let conflict = Array.make nslots false in
  57.       List.iter
  58.         (fun r ->
  59.           match r.loc with
  60.             Stack(Local n) ->
  61.               if Proc.register_class r = cl then conflict.(n) <- true
  62.           | _ -> ())
  63.         reg.interf;
  64.       let slot = ref 0 in
  65.       while !slot < nslots && conflict.(!slot) do incr slot done;
  66.       reg.loc <- Stack(Local !slot);
  67.       if !slot >= nslots then num_stack_slots.(cl) <- !slot + 1
  68.     end else if reg.degree < Proc.num_available_registers.(cl) then
  69.       unconstrained := reg :: !unconstrained
  70.     else begin
  71.       constrained := OrderedRegSet.add reg !constrained
  72.     end in

  74.   (* Iterate over all registers preferred by the given register (transitive) *)
  75. ‌  let iter_preferred f reg =
  76.     let rec walk r w =
  77.       if not (Reg.is_visited r) then begin
  78.         Reg.mark_visited r;
  79.         f r w;
  80.         List.iter (fun (r1, w1) -> walk r1 (Int.min w w1)) r.prefer
  81.       end in
  82.     List.iter (fun (r, w) -> walk r w) reg.prefer;
  83.     Reg.clear_visited_marks () in

  85.   (* Where to start the search for a suitable register.
  86.      Used to introduce some "randomness" in the choice between registers
  87.      with equal scores. This offers more opportunities for scheduling. *)
  88. ‌  let start_register = Array.make Proc.num_register_classes 0 in

  90.   (* Assign a location to a register, the best we can. *)
  91. ‌  let assign_location reg =
  92.     let cl = Proc.register_class reg in
  93.     let first_reg = Proc.first_available_register.(cl) in
  94.     let num_regs = Proc.num_available_registers.(cl) in
  95.     let score = Array.make num_regs 0 in
  96.     let best_score = ref (-1000000) and best_reg = ref (-1) in
  97.     let start = start_register.(cl) in
  98.     if num_regs <> 0 then begin
  99.       (* Favor the registers that have been assigned to pseudoregs for which
  100.          we have a preference. If these pseudoregs have not been assigned
  101.          already, avoid the registers with which they conflict. *)
  102.       iter_preferred
  103.         (fun r w ->
  104.           match r.loc with
  105.             Reg n -> let n = n - first_reg in
  106.                      if n < num_regs then
  107.                        score.(n) <- score.(n) + w
  108.           | Unknown ->
  109.               List.iter
  110.                 (fun neighbour ->
  111.                   match neighbour.loc with
  112.                     Reg n -> let n = n - first_reg in
  113.                              if n < num_regs then
  114.                                score.(n) <- score.(n) - w
  115.                   | _ -> ())
  116.                 r.interf
  117.           | _ -> ())
  118.         reg;
  119.       List.iter
  120.         (fun neighbour ->
  121.           (* Prohibit the registers that have been assigned
  122.              to our neighbours *)
  123.           begin match neighbour.loc with
  124.             Reg n -> let n = n - first_reg in
  125.                      if n < num_regs then
  126.                        score.(n) <- (-1000000)
  127.           | _ -> ()
  128.           end;
  129.           (* Avoid the registers that have been assigned to pseudoregs
  130.              for which our neighbours have a preference *)
  131.           iter_preferred
  132.             (fun r w ->
  133.               match r.loc with
  134.                 Reg n -> let n = n - first_reg in
  135.                          if n < num_regs then
  136.                            score.(n) <- score.(n) - (w-1)
  137.                          (* w-1 to break the symmetry when two conflicting regs
  138.                             have the same preference for a third reg. *)
  139.               | _ -> ())
  140.             neighbour)
  141.         reg.interf;
  142.       (* Pick the register with the best score *)
  143.       for n = start to num_regs - 1 do
  144.         if score.(n) > !best_score then begin
  145.           best_score := score.(n);
  146.           best_reg := n
  147.         end
  148.       done;
  149.       for n = 0 to start - 1 do
  150.         if score.(n) > !best_score then begin
  151.           best_score := score.(n);
  152.           best_reg := n
  153.         end
  154.       done
  155.     end;
  156.     (* Found a register? *)
  157.     if !best_reg >= 0 then begin
  158.       reg.loc <- Reg(first_reg + !best_reg);
  159.       if Proc.rotate_registers then
  160.         start_register.(cl) <- (let start = start + 1 in
  161.                                 if start >= num_regs then 0 else start)
  162.     end else begin
  163.       (* Sorry, we must put the pseudoreg in a stack location *)
  164. ‌      let nslots = num_stack_slots.(cl) in
  165. ‌      let score = Array.make nslots 0 in
  166.       (* Compute the scores as for registers *)
  167.       List.iter
  168.         (fun (r, w) ->
  169.           match r.loc with
  170.             Stack(Local n) -> score.(n) <- score.(n) + w
  171.           | Unknown ->
  172.               List.iter
  173.                 (fun neighbour ->
  174.                   match neighbour.loc with
  175.                     Stack(Local n) -> score.(n) <- score.(n) - w
  176.                   | _ -> ())
  177.                 r.interf
  178.           | _ -> ())
  179.         reg.prefer;
  180.       List.iter
  181.         (fun neighbour ->
  182.           begin match neighbour.loc with
  183.               Stack(Local n) -> score.(n) <- (-1000000)
  184.           | _ -> ()
  185.           end;
  186.           List.iter
  187.             (fun (r, w) ->
  188.               match r.loc with
  189.                 Stack(Local n) -> score.(n) <- score.(n) - w
  190.               | _ -> ())
  191.             neighbour.prefer)
  192.         reg.interf;
  193.       (* Pick the location with the best score *)
  194. ‌      let best_score = ref (-1000000) and best_slot = ref (-1) in
  195.       for n = 0 to nslots - 1 do
  196.         if score.(n) > !best_score then begin
  197.           best_score := score.(n);
  198.           best_slot := n
  199.         end
  200.       done;
  201.       (* Mark this register as spilled so that we don't waste time trying
  202.          to put in in a register if we have to redo regalloc due to Reload *)
  203.       reg.spill <- true;
  204.       (* Found one? *)
  205.       if !best_slot >= 0 then
  206.         reg.loc <- Stack(Local !best_slot)
  207.       else begin
  208.         (* Allocate a new stack slot *)
  209.         reg.loc <- Stack(Local nslots);
  210.         num_stack_slots.(cl) <- nslots + 1
  211.       end
  212.     end;
  213.     (* Cancel the preferences of this register so that they don't influence
  214.        transitively the allocation of registers that prefer this reg. *)
  215.     reg.prefer <- [] in

  217.   (* First pass: preallocate spill registers and split remaining regs
  218.      Second pass: assign locations to constrained regs
  219.      Third pass: assign locations to unconstrained regs *)
  220.   List.iter remove_reg (Reg.all_registers());
  221.   OrderedRegSet.iter assign_location !constrained;
  222.   List.iter assign_location !unconstrained;
  223.   num_stack_slots
